author: Giuseppe Tempone
comment: The app is great, developers did a good job. But I have one missing feature to mention: p.e. in whatsapp I receive messages in different languages (English, Italian, Portuguese, Dutch) , and all of them are spoken with the default language (English),and it is pretty annoying. This language resiliency feature is present in one app in the play store (@Voice Aloud Reader) which speaks in the language of the webpage or whatever other content in the appropriate language and it would be a great feature if your app has it too. Is it in your plans to implement that in the future?

author: Andrew Dumas
comment: Audify is the best of this type of app available. I use it constantly, it works perfectly.  I recently had an issue with my Bluetooth hearing aids not turning on quickly enough to relay short notifications. Even though it wasn't an Audify problem, the developers took the time to analyse what was happening and provided a solution.  Outstanding support!

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content: Thank you for the review Andrew. Glad to help you out 🙂

author: John Joy
comment: Still a 5... Starting a new year right. I never give 5 stars, but you made it. The one app I am truly happy using, & with great support. Thank you.

author: James Cartner-Young
comment: SCAMWARE...   AUTHOR IS WORRYINGLY SILENT IN RESPONSE TO HIS USERS LEGITIMATE OBSERVATIONS.  BAD DEVELOPER.  YOU GET 250 FREE ANNOUNCEMENTS THEN IT'LL STOP WORKING AND DEMAND MONEY TO CONTINUE!  BAD APPLICATION.  PATHETIC SCAM... DON'T DOWNLOAD... A COMPLETE WASTE OF EVERYBODY'S TIME.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi James,
Audify has in app purchase to unlock it for lifetime across all your devices. Trial has only 250 notifications and it is clearly stated in the description. 

Thanks,
Appkiddo

author: Tahn Costelloe
comment: One of my favourite essential Android apps. Would love it if there was a way to read out notifications on Google Home devices.

author: Shannan Bax
comment: Would love if this app had Tasker/automate plug-in support to allow more control

author: dadeng suryana
comment: Ok

author: Owen Stillman
comment: It's great. Works flawlessly and people learn I have this so know to be descriptive when they know I'm driving for important information.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content: Glad to know Owen. Thank you for the review 👍

author: Alex McGunn
comment: Best notification reader so far

author: Russ Hamshaw
comment: This is a great app

author: Sloan Mergler
comment: Worked beautifully on my pixel before I upgraded to 8.0.0... now It won't work because it keeps thinking it doesn't have notification permission, even though it does

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Sloan,
Please restart your device and try again. If the issue persists then please drop an email to appkiddohelp@gmail.com

Thanks,
Appkiddo

comment: I have been using audify for a while, it works great and I love it.

author: Joe V
comment: Truly AMAZING App! I use a bluetooth headset, have it configured to activate when I turn on the headset and filtered it to just the notifications I want read aloud. Works flawlessly and very convenient when I walking, working, driving...   One bug, after each update, app notifications stop being read aloud. I have to delete and re-pair my bluetooth headset to fix it.
Best notification caller I've used

author: Preston Roberts
comment: Must have app for me now.  It still occasionally will re read a notification, and sometimes it won't fire at all for seemingly no reason, but it's rare that there's a problem like this.  The development team is great and loves feedback, so suggestions and issues are actually heard rather than ignored like other devs.  I can't possibly recommend this enough.  Great app.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Preston,
Glad to know that you liked it. Please write your suggestions to appkiddohelp@gmail.com. 

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Zombi Andrew
comment: App kept automatically turning itself on speaker randomly, then began interfering with ALL audio playback. Took 2 MONTHS to get an email response from Dev, and their "fix" was to blame me for settings. DO NOT RECOMMEND, especially for Note/Samsung users

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Zombi:
It seems like you might have enabled privacy mode. Please disable it under Audify Settings - Notification Settings - Privacy mode. Now Audify will read whole message.

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Aaron Schaffer
comment: Had some issues with the app reading my notifications after the last couple updates. Contacted the developer who had great communication and my issue was resolved after the most recent update. Terrific app. It's a life saver while I drive and ride my motorcycle. Thank you!

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Aaron,
Glad to help and thanks for updating your review 🙂 Write to appkiddohelp@gmail.com for any other feedback/suggestion.

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Dan Johansson
comment: Update: I was in contact with support. They asked all the standard questions. Having me go through hoops while none of it was leading anywhere. After a phone update and reinstall it no longer completely kills audio. However it keeps not reading anything when texts are recieved. It just lowers the volume of whatever is playing. Occationally it works. Really annoying. It seems to me that my settings keep getting reset to defaults. I regret paying for it.  Previously: "It worked decently for a while. Had to uninstall it because it no longer works. Kills the sound for all apps on my BT headphones (Bose QC35). I tried to reinstall it but get the same issue. Shame 'cause I payed for unlimited. Useless for me currently unfortunately."

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Dan,
Please drop an email to appkiddohelp@gmail.com. We can help you out.

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Ben Beattie-Hood
comment: If you ever use headphones or a Bluetooth with your phone, you should install this without delay. Full of useful features, easy to use (and customise if needed), sensible permissions, completely reliable with any headset on all the apps I use (custom calendar, Gmail, custom SMS, phone, etc). Developers like this should be lauded.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Ben,
Glad to see your review. Happy to know that you are enjoying Audify :)

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Siari Dee
comment: Although I enable both via speaker and headset it sometimes or often  disable the enable via speaker and have to manually enable it. This kinda weird.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Siari,
Thanks for your review. Audify does disable speaker mode on device restart to not to embarrass you by speaking straightaway when you turn on your device. 

Thanks
Team Audify

author: Rob Macasieb
comment: Great idea, great execution.  I even bought the tee-shirt....  Although the tee was defective:(

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Rob,
Thanks for your review. We are delighted to know that you are enjoying Audify 🙂 We apologize about the defective t-shirt 🙁

Cheers,
Team Audify

author: Paul Rafferty
comment: Seriously hit and miss. More miss than hit. I got a total of 2 slack messages before it stopped working. It still reads my SMS. Never got Google music or my oncall pager to work at all.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Paul,
Audify has different conditions to read a notification. For example, Unlocking your device will make Audify to mute. Please drop an email to appkiddohelp@gmail.com to let us help you out.

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Ron B
comment: says you can disable app name for a specific app under app settings section... uh no you can't. also tutorial highlights don't line up with buttons. sloppy

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Ron,
Thanks for writing the review. You can disable app name for all apps under settings or you can disable for individual app under app settings screen. Sorry about the bug in tutorial. It sounds like a bug specific to your device model. We will test and fix it asap. 

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Mathias Körber
comment: Does not see what's app in my installed app list?

author: Andy S
comment: Works very well. Sometimes it reread old text msgs instead of the new one.

author: Andrew Fortier
comment: I'm makes you pay per notification.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Andrew,
Audify unlimited is one time purchase for lifetime. Hope it clarifies.

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Fatih Riantono
comment: Please have the option of sound alarm

author: J. Philip
comment: A must have app.

author: Heather Toma
comment: Love this while driving and just whenever i have my headset on!

author: Michael A. Campbell
comment: By far the best apply for speaking notifications.

author: Trial Judge
comment: Not working

author: Momen Ali
comment: Does this application support Arabic ?

author: Wan Google
comment: I love this application...good 😆😆😆😆😆

comment: nice!!!

author: ej tv afi
comment: Good app

author: Alessandro Codemo
comment: Simply perfect

author: Nadhi Tolis
comment: Love

author: Alan Wasserman
comment: This is a great app, now when driving I don't have to take my eyes off the road it tells me who is calling so I have time to pull over to answer if it is important to talk

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Alan:
Thanks for updating your review. Don't we deserve 5 stars :)

author: Riaan Hanekom
comment: Working like a charm so far.  Any plans to add Tasker support, specifically for enabling/disabling notifications​ over speaker?

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi Riaan,
Thanks for your review. Can you please write to us at appkiddohelp@gmail.com on tasker support. We would love to hear your thoughts.

Thanks,
Team Audify

author: Larry Boardman
comment: When listening to music messages can't be heard because music needs auto pause and auto resume hard to hear both at sametime. Also needs a replay for messages for Bluetooth. Then it would be worth buying. Hopefully this can be in the update.

reply.author: AppKiddo
reply.content:
Hi,
We have released a new feature called "Audio ducking" in latest update. If you disable audio ducking then music apps will pause during announcements. Hope you will give it a try and update your review.

Thanks,
Team Audify
